New Records: Germany achieved their biggest victory in Euros history
Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored two goals, Kai Havertz scored a penalty, Niclas Füllkrug scored a thunderbolt into the top right corner, and Emre Can curled in in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Germany captain İlkay Gündoğan had a good feeling before the game, and the team was looking to start the tournament with a confidence-boosting win
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann said the team dominated the first half and performed well early on, while Scotland coach Steve Clarke felt as though his team let themselves down
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the Euro 2024 curtainraiser, and the crowd included German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier, Scotland First Minister John Swinney, and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán
